DTS:Property.@DTS:Name: TaskContact
DTS:Property.#text: Performs high-performance data extraction, transformation and loading;Microsoft Corporation; Microsoft SQL Server v9; (C) 2004 Microsoft Corporation; All Rights Reserved;http://www.microsoft.com/sql/support/default.asp;1

component.@contactInfo: OLE DB Source;Microsoft Corporation;Microsoft SqlServer v9; (C) 2005 Microsoft Corporation; All Rights Reserved; http://www.microsoft.com/sql/support;7

property.@description: The number of seconds before a command times out.  A value of 0 indicates an infinite time-out.
Specifies the name of the database object used to open a rowset.
Specifies the variable that contains the name of the database object used to open a rowset.
The SQL command to be executed.
property.#text:
select
  g.GeographyKey
, g.SalesTerritoryKey  
, g.City
, g.StateProvinceName [State]
, g.PostalCode
from dbo.DimGeography g
join dbo.DimSalesTerritory t 
  on t.SalesTerritoryKey = g.SalesTerritoryKey
where t.SalesTerritoryCountry = 'United States' 
order by g.StateProvinceName, g.City

property.@description: The variable that contains the SQL command to be executed.
Specifies the column code page to use when code page information is unavailable from the data source.
Forces the use of the DefaultCodePage property value when describing character data.
Specifies the mode used to access the database.
The mappings between the parameters in the SQL command and variables.

connection.@description: The OLE DB runtime connection used to access the database.

component.@contactInfo: Derived Column;Microsoft Corporation;Microsoft SqlServer v9; (C) 2005 Microsoft Corporation; All Rights Reserved; http://www.microsoft.com/sql/support;0

input.@description: Input to the Derived Column Transformation

output.@description: Default Output of the Derived Column Transformation

property.@description: Derived Column Expression
Derived Column Friendly Expression

output.@description: Error Output of the Derived Column Transformation

component.@contactInfo: Excel Destination;Microsoft Corporation;Microsoft SqlServer v9; (C) 2005 Microsoft Corporation; All Rights Reserved; http://www.microsoft.com/sql/support;0

property.@description: The number of seconds before a command times out.  A value of 0 indicates an infinite time-out.
Specifies the name of the database object used to open a rowset.
Specifies the variable that contains the name of the database object used to open a rowset.
The SQL command to be executed.
Specifies the mode used to access the database.

Indicates whether the values supplied for identity columns will be copied to the destination. If false, values for identity columns will be auto-generated at the destination. Applies only if fast load is turned on.

Indicates whether the columns containing null will have null inserted in the destination. If false, columns containing null will have their default values inserted at the destinaton. Applies only if fast load is turned on.
Specifies options to be used with fast load.  Applies only if fast load is turned on.
Specifies when commits are issued during data insertion.  A value of 0 specifies that one commit will be issued at the end of data insertion.  Applies only if fast load is turned on.

connection.@description: The OLE DB runtime connection used to access the database.
